title: Google Sheets XOR Function

metadata.description: Learn about Google Sheets XOR Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Google Sheets XOR Function

XOR Function
The
XOR
function is a premade function in Google Sheets
content_sections.content:
, which returns
TRUE
or
FALSE
based on two or more
conditions
.
Note:
The XOR function is often used together with the
IF function
.

content_sections.title: It is typed
content_sections.content:
=XOR
:
=XOR(
logical_expression1
,
[logical2_expression, ...]
)
The
conditions
are referred to as
[logical_expression1]
,
[logical_expression2]
, and so on.
The conditions can check things like:
If a number is
greater than
another number
>
If a number is
smaller than
another number
<

content_sections.title:
If a number or text is
equal
to something
content_sections.content:
=
For two conditions, you can think of the XOR function as:
"
either
this
or
that, but
not both
"
Example XOR Function
Check if the Pokemon type is either Fire type
OR
has HP
less than
60, but
not both
:
The function returns "TRUE" or "FALSE".
Name	Type 1	HP	EITHER Fire Type OR less than 60 HP
    Bulbasaur	Grass	45	
    Ivysaur	Grass	60	
    Venusaur	Grass	80	
    Charmander	Fire	39	
    Charmeleon	Fire	58	
    Charizard	Fire	78	
    Squirtle	Water	44	
    Wartortle	Water	59	
    Blastoise	Water	79
Copy Values
Example
XOR
function, step by step:
Select the cell
D2

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=XOR
Click the
XOR
command
Specify the first condition
B2="Fire"
Type
,
Specify the second condition
C2<60
Hit enter
Note:
You can add more conditions by repeating steps 5-6 before hitting enter.
The XOR function returns "TRUE" if an
odd
number (1,3,5,..) of conditions are
TRUE
.
Since the value in cell
B2
is not "Fire" the first condition is
FALSE
.
Since the value in cell
C2
is less than 60 the second condition is
TRUE
.
For two conditions,
only one
condition should to be
TRUE
for the XOR function to return
TRUE
.
Note:
Text values needs to be in quotes: " "
The function can be repeated with the
filling function
for each row to perform the same check for each Pokemon:
Now, each row has a check for Fire Type
or
HP less than 60, but
not both
:
For example:
Ivysaur is
not
Fire type, but it also does not have
less
than 60 defense, so the function returns "FALSE"
Charmeleon
is
Fire type, and has
less
than 60 defense, so the function returns "FALSE"
Wartortle is
not
Fire type, but has
less
than 60 defense, so the function returns "TRUE"
Example XOR Function (with IF)
Combining the XOR function with an
IF function
lets you check
multiple
conditions for the IF function:
Note:
The IF function lets you specify the return values.

content_sections.title: The IF function is typed
content_sections.content:
=IF
and has 3 parts:
=IF(
logical_expression
,
value_if_true
,
value_if_false
)
The XOR function takes the place of the
logical_expression
condition.
Here, the
IF
function returns "Yes" or "No".
Example
XOR
function as the condition for
IF
function, step by step:
Select cell
D2

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=IF
Click the
IF
command
Type
XOR
Click the
XOR
command
Specify the first condition
B2="Fire"
Type
,
Specify the second condition
C2<60
Type
),
Specify the value
"Yes"
for when just one condition is
TRUE
Type
,
Specify the value
"No"
for when both are
FALSE
, or
TRUE
at the same time
Type
)
and hit enter
The function can be repeated with the
filling function
for each row to perform the same check for each Pokemon:
Now, each row has a check for Water Type
or
Defense greater than 60, but
not both
:
For example:
Ivysaur is
not
Fire type, but it also does not have
less
than 60 defense, so the function returns "No"
Charmeleon
is
Fire type, and has
less
than 60 defense, so the function returns "No"
Wartortle is
not
Fire type, but has
less
than 60 defense, so the function returns "Yes"

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
Name	Type 1	HP	EITHER Fire Type OR less than 60 HP
    Bulbasaur	Grass	45	
    Ivysaur	Grass	60	
    Venusaur	Grass	80	
    Charmander	Fire	39	
    Charmeleon	Fire	58	
    Charizard	Fire	78	
    Squirtle	Water	44	
    Wartortle	Water	59	
    Blastoise	Water	79

quiz.question:
What is Google Sheets XOR Function

XOR Function
The
XOR
function?
options: a premade function in Google Sheets

often used together with the
IF function
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of Google Sheets XOR Function

XOR Function
The
XOR
function is 'a premade function in Google Sheets'.

quiz.question: What is The XOR function?
options:
often used together with the
IF function
a premade function in Google Sheets
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of The XOR function is 'often used together with the
IF function'.

summary: This tutorial covers Google Sheets XOR Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Google Sheets XOR Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Google Sheets XOR Function and how to apply it in your projects.
